text: I wrote this tiny wrapper which "adapts" an array to unified memory instead of per-device memory. Its not quite right w.r.t. GC yet (but I think I can fix, granted I'm a noob here), but curious if something like this would be useful to have in CUDA, at least as a stopgap until more first-class unified memory support is achieved?
